title: Workshop on the Fundamentals of IoT Forensics | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: Learn IoT forensics to extract firmware from devices and prevent critical, life-threatening malware attacks in a 2-day workshop.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Workshop on the Fundamentals of IoT Forensics
Workshop on the Fundamentals of IoT Forensics
Learn IoT forensics to extract firmware from devices and prevent critical, life-threatening malware attacks in a 2-day workshop.
AI and Machine Learning, Cybersecurity, Internet of Things
Recently, with the sheer popularity of IoT devices, the number of malware focusing on IoT has multiplied exponentially.

This could be attributed to the large number of IoT devices we use in our everyday lives, from smartphones to vehicles, kitchen appliances, and television sets - that all contain IoT. Hence, the impact of a malware attack can be very critical and potentially life-threatening.

This course provides an introduction to IoT forensics. It caters to people from beginner hobbyists to security consultants to senior management. Whether you are a technical person who likes to get your fiddle with IoT hardware or a senior management who wonders how to reverse engineering an IoT device, this course will provide the basic knowledge you need.

This 2-day workshop seeks to introduce and equip an individual with knowledge and skills of various tools to extract firmware from an IoT device. Hands-on practicals will be conducted in both afternoon sessions to complete the workshop.
For this beginner course, no prior electronic knowledge is required
Basic Linux commands such as directory listing, executing of scripts
Tapping into IoT devices from serial-port
Hands-on practical to identify and obtain access to the Linux shell
Tapping into IoT devices from JTAG-port
Hands-on practical on using Open-source tools
Hands-on practical to identify JTAG pins and obtain access to extract the firmware
Extracting firmware directly from flash memory
Flash Memory used in IoT devices
Hands-on practical to identify flash memory and extract the firmware
Assistant Professor, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Assistant Professor, Infocomm Technology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Fauzi has over 15 years of experience working with embedded systems and IoT, and a PhD in embedded computing systems security. His expertise covers porting and optimising RTOS to develop a security-based application for IoT platforms. His recent work in cybersecurity is to create a multi-modal early intrusion detection for IoT platforms have been published, presented and demonstrated at various conferences, symposiums, and exhibitions locally and overseas. He was a finalist in the year-long Tech Factor Challenge to develop a medical IoT device from concept to prototype. He also has experience designing, teaching, and mentoring undergraduate and graduate students in multiple IoT-related subjects.
Serial Communication & Basic Linux shell command
Guided hands-on to identify and access Serial-port and JTAG-port
Guided hands-on on Linux Shell on exploited device
JTAG Communication & Introduction to Bus Pirate
Flash Memory & Tools of the trade
Hands-on practical to identify and access flash memory
A Certificate of Participation will be issued to participants who
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
The full fee for this course is S$1,962.00
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
Learn more about funding schemes available
The Learn for Life token may be used for this course
There are no upcoming course runs at the moment.

Learning for Life Series - Seaw Ker Boon

He may have already traded in his student card for a staff pass, but SIT alumni and staff member Seaw Ker Boon chose to head back to the classroom to become a student once again. The aspiring software architect shares why he attended the Machine Learning courses under the SITLEARN programme.
SIT Partners MINDEF to Offer Cyber NSF Scheme

Minister for Education (Higher Education and Skills) and Second Minister for Defence Ong Ye Kung officiated at the signing of a work-learn Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between the Ministry of Defence (MINDEF)’s Defence Cyber Organisation (DCO) and the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) on 12 February 2018. The MOU was signed by Defence Cyber Chief Mr David Koh and Professor Loh Han Tong, Deputy President (Academic) and Provost, SIT.
The recent outbreak of WannaCry affected more than 200,000 individuals in over 150 countries, including Singapore.
Be introduced to creative AI, covering generative models, their applications, ethics, and hands-on experience.
Machine Learning and AI Data Analytics for the Semiconductor Industry
Learn to address semiconductor manufacturing complexities with AI and ML and gain hands-on experience using Python programming.
Data Science and Analytics, AI and Machine Learning, Executive Education
This course demystifies machine learning concepts and helps you gain technical grounding and foresight for digital transformation in business.
AI and Machine Learning, Computer Ethics and Privacy
An executive programme that trains leaders in open source technology, risk management, and innovation, preparing them for Chief Open Source Officer roles.
Business Management, Leadership and Communication, Internet of Things, Executive Education
Specialised micro-credential for strong technical and theoretical expertise in data analytics. Earn a Specialist Certificate and stack it towards a degree in Electrical and Electronic Engineering.
BEng (Hons) Electrical & Electronic Engineering or Infrastructure & Systems Engineering
Data Science and Analytics, AI and Machine Learning, Competency-based Education
Information Security Risk Management and Audit

Specialised micro-credential for strong technical and theoretical expertise in information systems audit, security management, and risk management based on Agile. Earn a Specialist Certificate and stack it towards a degree in Applied Computing.
Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Applied Computing (via the CSM Pathway)
Information Security, Cybersecurity, Risk Management, Audit, Competency-based Education

Exciting news! We are introducing new micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Be among the first to know by registering your interest today!
